intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. parviceps, commonly known as the lesser oxeye daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features a basal rosette of silver-white, hairy leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and blooms from late spring to early autumn. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
